Hello,

This doc is prepared for clarifying effect of Handover processâ€™s to Tableau Reports and what to do in Handover Process for Reports.

> Info: Note: The necessity of this document has become visible after whole Tableau Cloud Migration and creation of project, hub based Tableau Cloud accounts

#### What has changed from Tableau Server â†’ Tableau Cloud.

Our old Tableau Server has been used with 1 account which is InventService2 and whole refresh tasks are handled by same user. Also we can manage the whole reporting process with same account because of the non existing MFA configurations.

After the migration we noticed that Tableau Cloud needs MFA for logging and that new feature blocks us for using same method as Tableau Server.

So we switched the our accounting to use project(customer) and CX-Hub based accounts. Which some of them also started using since in Migration.

oject(customer) and CX-Hub based accounts. Which some of them also started using since in Migration.

While the project is handing over to CX, report owners must be changed to related Hubâ€™s user account and connection credentials need to be restored after reports owner change.

### How to change owner of report:

### Why this is necessary ?

Because Tableau sends the reportâ€™s refresh failure email to reportâ€™s owner. So we need to make sure that related hub will receive these failure messages.

After changing owner of the report. It is crucial to embed the password and tokens right away.

### How to restore the connections:

### For DBX connections:

Enter DBX token to password field and save. (donâ€™t forget to test and make sure)

### For MSSQL connections:

X token to password field and save. (donâ€™t forget to test and make sure)

### For MSSQL connections:

Enter the reporting userâ€™s credentials and save (no need to test Tableau canâ€™t connect to db without bridge so it will fail on test. But donâ€™t worry this will successfully refresh if you are sure that you embedded correct password)

### Why this is needed?

When you transfer the ownership of a Workbook or Data Source to another user, Tableau automatically deletes the embedded credentials (database usernames/passwords) associated with that content.

This is a security feature. Tableau ensures that the previous owner's credentials are not inadvertently used or accessible by the new owner.

> Info: PLEASE CHECK YOUR REPORTâ€™S REFRESH AFTER WHOLE PROCESS AND MAKE SURE THAT REFRESH HAS NO AUTHENTICATION ERRORS

First things first you need the shared accountâ€™s credentials. Please create a permission request on ADMIN project.

1-) Locate the note on Lastpass and copy the credentials and paste it on tableau login screen

Use the credentials below for logging in to desired Tableau Cloud Site.
US Customers = site: invent-us = [https://us-east-1.online.tableau.com/](https://us-east-1.online.tableau.com/)
EMEA Customers = site: invent-eu = [https://dub01.online.tableau.com/](https://us-east-1.online.tableau.com/)

Since we use shared accounts we need to use shared authenticator for access. Authenticator code can be generated through Virtual Machine we created.

How to connect Virtual Machine for receiving authenticator code :

Windows:

Connect to VPN

Type 'RDP' into search box and open the app

Enter the username and computer (IP) like below (you can find these on note) and click connect

Lastpass note section

Click Yes here and connect to VM
